body_content.explanation: (of a play, piece of music, dance, etc.) able to be acted, sung, played, etc. as entertainment:
examples: The composer took another four years to flesh out the skeleton into a performable score.
The dramatizations are impressive in their originality of approach and theatricality of conception, making them both eminently performable.

body_content.explanation: (of an action or piece of work) able to be done:
examples: The technique is performable if vascular surgeons and interventional radiologists work side by side in the operating theatre.
The executive branch has been assigned a function that in the past was performable by the Legislature itself.
